verses.text_plain: Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity, than he that is perverse in his lips, and is a fool.
verses.verse_html: 1Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity, than he that is perverse in his lips, and is a fool.

verses.text_plain: Also, that the soul be without knowledge, it is not good; and he that hasteth with his feet sinneth.
verses.verse_html: 2Also, that the soul be without knowledge, it is not good; and he that hasteth with his feet sinneth.

verses.text_plain: The foolishness of man perverteth his way: and his heart fretteth against the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 3The foolishness of man perverteth his way: and his heart fretteth against the Lord.

verses.text_plain: Wealth maketh many friends; but the poor is separated from his neighbour.
verses.verse_html: 4Wealth maketh many friends; but the poor is separated from his neighbour.

verses.text_plain: A false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh lies shall not escape.
verses.verse_html:
5A false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh lies shall not escape. ▼
▼ unpunished: Heb. held innocent

footnotes.body_html: ▼ unpunished: Heb. held innocent

verses.text_plain: Many will intreat the favour of the prince: and every man is a friend to him that giveth gifts.
verses.verse_html:
6Many will intreat the favour of the prince: and every man is a friend to him that giveth gifts. ▼
▼ him…: Heb. a man of gifts

footnotes.body_text: ▼ him…: Heb. a man of gifts
footnotes.body_html: ▼ him…: Heb. a man of gifts

verses.text_plain: All the brethren of the poor do hate him: how much more do his friends go far from him? he pursueth them with words, yet they are wanting to him.
verses.verse_html: 7All the brethren of the poor do hate him: how much more do his friends go far from him? he pursueth them with words, yet they are wanting to him.

tokens.text: him: how much more do his friends

verses.text_plain: He that getteth wisdom loveth his own soul: he that keepeth understanding shall find good.
verses.verse_html:
8He that getteth wisdom loveth his own soul: he that keepeth understanding shall find good. ▼
▼ wisdom: Heb. an heart

footnotes.body_html: ▼ wisdom: Heb. an heart

verses.text_plain: A false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh lies shall perish.
verses.verse_html: 9A false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh lies shall perish.

verses.text_plain: Delight is not seemly for a fool; much less for a servant to have rule over princes.
verses.verse_html: 10Delight is not seemly for a fool; much less for a servant to have rule over princes.

verses.text_plain: The discretion of a man deferreth his anger; and it is his glory to pass over a transgression.
verses.verse_html:
11The discretion of a man deferreth his anger; and it is his glory to pass over a transgression. ▼
▼ discretion: or, prudence

verses.text_plain: The king’s wrath is as the roaring of a lion; but his favour is as dew upon the grass.
verses.verse_html: 12The king’s wrath is as the roaring of a lion; but his favour is as dew upon the grass.

verses.text_plain: A foolish son is the calamity of his father: and the contentions of a wife are a continual dropping.
verses.verse_html: 13A foolish son is the calamity of his father: and the contentions of a wife are a continual dropping.

verses.text_plain: House and riches are the inheritance of fathers: and a prudent wife is from the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 14House and riches are the inheritance of fathers: and a prudent wife is from the Lord.

verses.text_plain: Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep; and an idle soul shall suffer hunger.
verses.verse_html: 15Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep; and an idle soul shall suffer hunger.

verses.text_plain: He that keepeth the commandment keepeth his own soul; but he that despiseth his ways shall die.
verses.verse_html: 16He that keepeth the commandment keepeth his own soul; but he that despiseth his ways shall die.

verses.text_plain: He that hath pity upon the poor lendeth unto the Lord; and that which he hath given will he pay him again.
verses.verse_html:
17He that hath pity upon the poor lendeth unto the Lord; and that which he hath given will he pay him again. ▼
▼ that which…: or, his deed

tokens.text: and that which he hath given

footnotes.body_html: ▼ that which…: or, his deed

verses.text_plain: Chasten thy son while there is hope, and let not thy soul spare for his crying.
verses.verse_html:
18Chasten thy son while there is hope, and let not thy soul spare for his crying. ▼
▼ for…: or, to his destruction: or, to cause him to die

footnotes.body_text: ▼ for…: or, to his destruction: or, to cause him to die
footnotes.body_html: ▼ for…: or, to his destruction: or, to cause him to die

verses.text_plain: A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment: for if thou deliver him, yet thou must do it again.
verses.verse_html:
19A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment: for if thou deliver him, yet thou must do it again. ▼
▼ do: Heb. add

tokens.text: yet thou must do it again

verses.text_plain: Hear counsel, and receive instruction, that thou mayest be wise in thy latter end.
verses.verse_html: 20Hear counsel, and receive instruction, that thou mayest be wise in thy latter end.

verses.text_plain: There are many devices in a man’s heart; nevertheless the counsel of the Lord, that shall stand.
verses.verse_html: 21There are many devices in a man’s heart; nevertheless the counsel of the Lord, that shall stand.

verses.text_plain: The desire of a man is his kindness: and a poor man is better than a liar.
verses.verse_html: 22The desire of a man is his kindness: and a poor man is better than a liar.

verses.text_plain: The fear of the Lord tendeth to life: and he that hath it shall abide satisfied; he shall not be visited with evil.
verses.verse_html: 23The fear of the Lord tendeth to life: and he that hath it shall abide satisfied; he shall not be visited with evil.

verses.text_plain: A slothful man hideth his hand in his bosom, and will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.
verses.verse_html: 24A slothful man hideth his hand in his bosom, and will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.

tokens.text: and will not so much as bring

verses.text_plain: Smite a scorner, and the simple will beware: and reprove one that hath understanding, and he will understand knowledge.
verses.verse_html:
25Smite a scorner, and the simple will beware: and reprove one that hath understanding, and he will understand knowledge. ▼
▼ will beware: Heb. will be cunning

footnotes.body_text: ▼ will beware: Heb. will be cunning
footnotes.body_html: ▼ will beware: Heb. will be cunning

verses.text_plain: He that wasteth his father, and chaseth away his mother, is a son that causeth shame, and bringeth reproach.
verses.verse_html: 26He that wasteth his father, and chaseth away his mother, is a son that causeth shame, and bringeth reproach.

verses.text_plain: Cease, my son, to hear the instruction that causeth to err from the words of knowledge.
verses.verse_html: 27Cease, my son, to hear the instruction that causeth to err from the words of knowledge.

verses.text_plain: An ungodly witness scorneth judgment: and the mouth of the wicked devoureth iniquity.
verses.verse_html:
28An ungodly witness scorneth judgment: and the mouth of the wicked devoureth iniquity. ▼
▼ An…: Heb. A witness of Belial

footnotes.body_text: ▼ An…: Heb. A witness of Belial
footnotes.body_html: ▼ An…: Heb. A witness of Belial

verses.text_plain: Judgments are prepared for scorners, and stripes for the back of fools.
verses.verse_html: 29Judgments are prepared for scorners, and stripes for the back of fools.
